meta.description: This layer is a high-resolution (250-metre grid) forecast product that shows areas where West Nile virus circulation is likely to occur. It’s created by combining environmental satellite observations (temperature, vegetation, precipitation proxies) with epidemiological/mosquito-ecology models to estimate where conditions favor mosquito survival and viral transmission. For public health teams it’s useful as an early-warning map to prioritize mosquito control, targeted surveillance, and community warnings at a neighborhood scale rather than just county level.

sources.name: Baltic Sea Vibrio Risk Map (SST based)

meta.description: Multi-year product illustrating locations in the Baltic Sea where sea surface temperatures (SST) and other conditions have been favourable for Non-Cholera Vibrio growth, covering roughly 1995–2019. Produced by combining historical SST records (satellite and/or reanalyses) with ecological thresholds for Vibrio proliferation to show where and when public-health risks from seawater exposure or seafood consumption are elevated. Uses include seasonal bathing advisories, fisheries monitoring, and studies of climate-driven pathogen expansion. Methods adapted from: Baker-Austin et al., 2013.
